tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:44 yo female presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (LOC 39 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 20 mph on impact. patient c/o severe headache, mild vomiting, moderate nausea and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 62 in, Weight 207 lbs, Temperature 99.1 F, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 18, MRI Brain Unremarkable, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

she was struck while passing through intersection ,

td.content: s:44 yr old white female locksmith presents for one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 39 min). she denies vomiting, headache and nausea since the accident. she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 62 in, Weight 203 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=97,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.47, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness from 31 to 59 minutes). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex
